issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Quite a number of the bucket* tests had Wrong Results or Execution Failures.

And others like semijoin, skewjoin, avro_decimal_native, mapjoin_addjar, mapjoin_decimal, nullgroup, decimal_join, mapjoin1.

Some of the problems might be as simple as "-- SORT_QUERY_RESULTS" is missing.

The bucket* problems looked more serious.

*This change sets "hive.vectorized.execution.enabled" to false at the top of those Q files.*

*Subtasks need to be created to investigate the issues.*
fields.summary: Vectorization: Defer Wrong Results / Execution Failures when Vectorization turned on

comments.body: Hi [~mmccline] Thanks for the patch. Do we need this in branch-2 as well? I am guessing we should need q.out update as well since we are modifying .q files?

My guess is that just adding "SET hive.vectorized.execution.enabled=false;" to the Q files will not change the Q output files.  The Hive QA queue is short right now so I'll find out soon.  Please +1 tests pending.
most q files have explain plan statements. Will they not change?

It would when HIVE-19269 goes in turning hive.vectorized.execution.enabled on.  However, this change should hopefully prevent any EXPLAIN plan output changes.  And, leave the Wrong Results / Execution Failures to investigated later.
The huge challenge of HIVE-19269 is 1,500 Q file diffs...

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12920311/HIVE-19275.01.patch
